Reviews.Title: “Horrible place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: goshelby7
Reviews.Content: Limited housekeeping service, no tissue paper or soap for stayovers of more than a week, no hand towels or extra towels, bed bugs, laundry facilities terrible, pool close at 8pm, a dollar charge for any lost key and just 2 housekeeper for the entire building. Can't be more ghetto. Police is almost there every week. Worst place ever!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay for a week in Orlando and have extra money left over!”
Reviews.Author: VegasChik
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here at this location about 5 times now, I usually travel alone, and for me to be comfortable (as a female) someplace is saying that i feel safe here. I dont care what anyone says, but $149+tax for 7 nights stay anywhere is awesome..as long as you like it, It is super duper close to Disney World and right off the major freeway and highway. House cleaning is only done once a week tho and you must empty your own trash. this is just fine for me because i not like random housekeepers coming into my "private" room each morning to clean.I never see anyone "hanging out" (even late at night) and i am never awakened with loud people or noises. I like to stay on the top floor and love the fact there is a full refrigerator and microwave. but remember, this is a no frills weekly and people make this their home, so for larger families?? Only bummer i would say is that there is no daily housekeeping and it might get messy for you, but greatttttt way to save money for other things you want to do while you are in town! Im going back again this month!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Rude Management”
Reviews.Author: jostolaza
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at this roach motel n it was horrible! when i first made the reservation i spoke to kathy at the front desk and it was the most pleasing experience which made me think the hotel was fabulous. when we got to the hotel around noon we waited almost ten minutes at the front desk for the desk clerk who was carrying a baby in her arms as she registered us in. she did not apologize for the extensive wait and seemed to have a hateful attitude towards us. she gave us keys to two different rooms and the doors did not open. my husband was getting aggravated so hoping the third room would be good enough, we went ahead and registered and paid for one week and a ridiculous security deposit of $100. our room did not have a coffee maker or an alarm clock. the room was very clean but it looked worn out. the tv was red, the ac leaked all over our clothes, and the remotes didn't work. out of all the remotes they brought, none of them had backs. they had duct tape holding the batteries. i was fed up with this and decided that i wanted to checkout, and immediately went to the front desk. once again waited several minutes for the clerk to come out, and i asked for a manager. she said she was the manager and showed us where we signed stating there were no refunds allowed. i was not even in the room for one hour and everything was left as crappy as it was when we first got there. we ended up staying since we couldn't afford to go without our funds. i was surprised when the front desk told me they had a wake up call feature but it did not work. the time was off by over half an hour, and i ended up missing myflight. thank god i didnt purchase refundable tickets. at check-in, my family stayed in a room two floors down from mine. when we asked to be roomed close together, the desk clerk said half of the rooms were destroyed and they had no available rooms close by so we had to spend our lifetime savings on rooms two stories apart. the next day, kathy at the front desk, helped me out and moved me right next to my famly and this was the only nice thing anyone did for me. she even walked us to the rooms herself to ensure they were good enough. the manager should learn a thing or two from kathy. the first two nights a man who looked like a drug dealer was in the parking lot talking with a woman in her car and later we found out it was the security guard. he seemed very intimidating, sluggish, and disgusting. the next morning, we woke up with absolutely no water and the front desk staff kept saying that it was being repaired. the water did not return until late that afternoon so we could not go to any of the disney parks. my kids were very disappointed, so we took them to the pool. i thought it would be kinda nice to go with my husband to the hot tub, but I soon found out why it was lonely. It was filled up with dirt and dead plants. we packed everything and decided it was ust better to go and lose all our money rather than continue to live this nightmare. luckily, kathy was working the desk that evening, and she apologized for all inconveniences, and offered to call the general manager. he was corteous enough to charge us for the three nights we stayed and refund the deposit and the rest of my money. they were kind enough to offer us to stay at teh other home suite home but we wouldnt want to stay anywhere near this company. the rude front desk girl should not be in the hospitality business she is terrible. i work for a hotel and if i ever treated a customer like that i would be out of a job.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond the worst motel ever”
Reviews.Author: sarah2570
Reviews.Content: It was my birthday weekend. thinking I was going to Kissimmee for a nice get away.was I in for a surpise.the motel was so gross and dirty. and you better bring your own laundry soap and bathroom tissue,because they dont give you any there.and be ready to make your own bed,because they dont do that either. I was so upset. so please read the reviews before stay here it might save you from having the worst stay of your live.

Reviews.Title: “it's what i call the "in between" hotel”
Reviews.Author: donjuanMichigan
Reviews.Content: good, economy hotel. i was there in august of 2004 when it was the eastgate inn. did not have any problems. i did notice that some of the air conditioners were leaking condensation on to the walk ways outside the door. was glad to hear it has been remodeled. i have been considering relocating to kissimmee. i may have to stay there until i get a permament place.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is my home and things are not bad”
Reviews.Author: enjoyinglive
Reviews.Content: I was upset when I lost my home and had to move into Home Suite Home but I have to say that things are not so bad. The hotel rents by the week and almost all of the rooms have been renevated. I have yet to see a bug in my room and the maintance staff is always on the go. I have never had to wait very long for a service call. We have two beds along with a full size fridge/freezer. The microwaves could be updated. The children who stay here seem to be very well behaved. Security at night is handled by a guy named CJ and he takes his job serious so I sleep well at night. The only disadvantance is the front desk staff and management. They are often rude and provide answers that change from day to day. The other Home Suite Home has offered having small pets and I wish this one would so that a lot of people who have pets can bring them along also. If you need transportation the bus stops right in front of the hotel. It is not the home that I want but it will do for now.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: loru100
Reviews.Content: The people giving this hotel glowing recommendations must be employees of the hotel. This is, by far, the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Don't be taken in by the cheap price, you get what you pay for. We had previously stayed at this hotel in 2004 when it was a Best Western. In five years Home Suite Home has managed to turn it into a roach motel. We arrived after midnight and didn't get a good look at the place until morning, needless to say we left that morning. There is not enough space here to list everything that was wrong with this hotel but the highlights include a hole in the wall where you could see into the next room, windows that wouldn't shut, dirt everywhere, you are given one roll of toilet paper for the week, no hair dryer, you have to wash your own towels, maid service is only once a week, I could go on and on. When I asked them if they had any other rooms I was told that was their best room. The maintainance man came to look at the hole in the wall and said he could move us to the room next door but vagrants tended to break into that room. That was enough for me...we checked out right then.

Reviews.Title: “extra value suites”
Reviews.Author: traveleman1
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay,the staff were friendly and rooms were newly renovated,full size refrigerators and microwave were handy.The value for economical pricing was a bonus. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “nice little place”
Reviews.Author: gemini6kat
Reviews.Content: the staff at the hotel were courteous, considerate, and responsive to all of my needs and concerns during my stay. If I had to choose all over again, I would gladly stay there time and time again, even if it costed thrice as much! The low rates are but a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Just Like Home”
Reviews.Author: GrannyV042
Reviews.Content: Home Suite Home is comfortable with newly renovated rooms with full size refrigerator. Thats a plus for me. Manager Randy is super to work with or when needing anything additional for my room. Service is good with gift shop in from lobby, internet aCcess. Maintenance Charles always with a smile,is excellent getting things completed and I would recommend a week stay or longer. I am really enjoying my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't expecting the Ritz..great deal!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DisneynutDisneynut
Reviews.Content: I found this to be the best hotel for the price in the area. I didn't have the problems I read about and I was there for two weeks. The room was clean, the pool was great and my family felt safe. I could see the hotel is going through major renovations during the daytime, so may be they are addressing the problems I have read about. I will definitely stay there again for $169 per week, you can't beat it. I had a refrigerator too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, great price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the eastgate. We checked in and went to our room and found that the toilet was leaking. It was barely a drip, but we let the front desk know and they immediately apologized and moved us to another room which was ground level and poolside and should have cost more, but we were not charged any more. The rooms were clean, the staff very friendly and courteous. The housekeeping staff was amazing, everyday our room looked like we just checked in. They even took care to fold my children's blankies nicely on their bed. I had a great experience there and would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice On The Outside... Dumpy Inside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay an extra night in FL. and the hotel we were originally in was booked so we took a chance on the Eastgate Inn. It was a mile down the road in what seemed to be a safe area and looked more upscale with fountain, pool, hot tub and tennis courts. We are not picky by any means about hotels and are not accustomed to the lack of luxury, but this hotel had serious problems. First of all, the lady at the front desk was extremely cold and rude and silent when you asked her questions. We started to wonder if she was hard of hearing. Second, our room had roaches, excessive mildew on the shower curtain (not just one or two spots) a musty odor and dirty carpets. It was not clean at all and wallpaper was peeling off of the bathroom walls. The elevator was smelly and filthy. The pool was not heated and very COLD... and the hot tub was small and not heated well either. My family and I were disappointed, especially since we paid the same price as our other hotel and found the place so lacking... When we told the front desk lady in a polite manner about the roaches and mildew upon check-out, she didn't say one word. Didn't even acknowledge what we said. Someone who was staying at the hotel told us it has been bought by new owners... hopefully they will make some very necessary changes. It looks like it has potential to be a nice place if it were kept properly maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Un heathy rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had to evacuate due to a mandateory evacuation. My stay was horrible the rooms smell like mold, we had a major leak in room couldnt leave room dring hurricane to see if there was another room,we had a water fall not exagerated 5 feet into room from door and we were on the second floor asked about a discount nothing was offered.The power went out and we were told that there generators were inoperable...ohhhh and you could see the mold bleeding through the wall paper,and the ceiling so they where aware of the problem and never let anyone know of this..I will never stay there again as i have asthma and am allergic to molds......

Reviews.Title: “great hotel low price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. Spacious rooms, clean. Staff were very helpful and polite I had no problems and I am a wheelchair user. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Horrifying! NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in Feb 2004 when it was Best Western, NEVER was I informed that it was no longer a Best Western. So now when I am looking for the hotel to check in I spend extra time trying to find the "non" Best Western! We finally check in, get our key to the room only to find out that we cannot get in.....broken lock! We now have to get another room. We get into this room, well..........it has burnt out lights, moldy shower curtain, filthy air filter and BUGS!!!!! We complained multiple times!!! The maint. man took a shower curtain from the room next to us, along with one of their lightbulbs, I had to change the shower curtain because the maids did not pay attention to the complaint that was put in about the moldy shower curtain. We were told we could talk to the Night Auditor as there was not a manager available, this night auditor comes in at 11:30 pm and was to be there until 1pm (as told to us by the front desk) well, we went down at 7am but it was so busy we were not abel to talk to him, we are on vacation and should not have to wait around and waste our time, subsequesntly we never were able to voice our disgust to the right person. We had much more happen to us but I have not the time to write a novel just now. Unfortunately I prepaid for this hotel, otherwise I would have left this dump at high velocity. NOW to make matters worse I have been charged YET AGAIN!!! I called to fix this error only to be put on hold for 11 minutes (long distance) to be told to call back on Monday!!!! There is a hurricane coming which is to hit Tampa Bay, I was told that they were more concerned with this hurricane as it was their priority. Now, I am calling Orlando, it is not even 8am, the hurricane is to hit Tampa Bay sometime in the afternoon....why can I not be helped until Monday? Most infuriating!!!!! This should give you the general idea of the hotel though.

HotelInfo.Name: HomeSuiteHome Eastgate
HotelInfo.Address: 5565 West Irlo Bronson Memorial Pkwy., Kissimmee, FL 34746
